topics.title: Housing squeeze & rents
topics.description: Record-low vacancy rates in Zürich; new ideas like giving priority to Swiss/long-term residents are stirring backlash vs. fair-housing concerns.

candidates.name: Lina Meier
candidates.character: Progressive (left-leaning). Prioritises a stronger social safety net and public services; backs premium relief in LAMal and more cost controls; pro–cooperative/affordable housing; supports closer EU ties incl. a framework agreement; ambitious climate policy (net-zero 2050, public transport, renewables); liberal on migration/asylum with focus on integration; progressive taxation and childcare support; values direct democracy with citizen initiatives to expand social programs. Determined to win a governing mandate by mobilising the urban base while reassuring centrist swing voters with pragmatic, costed plans.

initial_policy_positions.topic_1: The housing squeeze is a major challenge, and we need solutions that prioritize fairness and affordability for all residents. I support expanding cooperative and affordable housing options, alongside measures to strengthen tenant protections and combat speculation. We must ensure that Zürich remains a city for everyone, not just the wealthy.

candidates.name: Markus Keller
candidates.character: Conservative (right-leaning). Emphasises free markets and limited government; prefers competition and efficiency in healthcare (managed care, higher deductibles choice) over new subsidies; pro-property rights and deregulation to spur private housing supply; EU-sceptical—prefers bilateral deals without automatic legal alignment; energy security via technology neutrality incl. new-gen nuclear; strict migration controls with faster procedures; supports tax relief and individual taxation; prioritises neutrality, security, and fiscal discipline. Focused on winning a centre-right mandate by uniting conservatives and persuading cost-conscious moderates with a stability-and-competence message.

initial_policy_positions.topic_1: The housing shortage in Zürich demands a market-based solution. We must streamline zoning regulations and promote private sector development to increase the housing supply. While I understand the concerns, I do not support preferential treatment based on residency status; instead, we need more homes for everyone.

demographics.name: Klaus Richter
demographics.demeanour: Energetic and customer-focused, with strong organizational skills.
demographics.backstory: Born 1904 in Berlin; completed commercial training 1922. Became a department manager at a large Berlin retail store in 1928, overseeing sales and inventory.

demographics.name: Daniel Müller
demographics.demeanour: Inquisitive and diligent, with a methodical approach to scientific study.
demographics.backstory: Born 1907; graduated with a degree in geological engineering in 1929. Worked for seven years mapping geological formations, primarily for resource extraction projects.

demographics.name: Hans Schmidt
demographics.demeanour: Diligent and methodical, excelling in hands-on problem resolution.
demographics.backstory: Completed vocational training in mechanical repair in 1920. Has worked as a maintenance technician at a factory in Spandau since 1926, maintaining critical machinery.

demographics.name: Greta Lehmann
demographics.demeanour: Conscientious and reserved, with a keen eye for organization.
demographics.backstory: Born 1914 in rural Prussia; moved to Berlin after high school. Employed since 1934 as a clerk in the Dahlem Botanical Garden administration, managing records and permits.

demographics.name: Anton Lehmann
demographics.demeanour: Meticulous and patient, dedicated to precision in his craft.
demographics.backstory: Apprenticed in optics in 1906, earning his master certification in 1910. He opened his own optical shop in Berlin in 1922, specializing in custom spectacle fittings.

demographics.name: Heinrich Gruber
demographics.demeanour: Inquisitive and focused, driven by a pursuit of scientific understanding.
demographics.backstory: He graduated from the University of Berlin in 1928 with a degree in medicine. He joined a research team at the Charité hospital in 1930, focusing on infectious diseases.

demographics.name: Klaus Fischer
demographics.demeanour: Meticulous and critical, often showing signs of worry over financial details.
demographics.backstory: Born 1901 in Stuttgart; completed his accounting bachelor's degree in 1923. Works as a chartered accountant for a manufacturing firm in Berlin since 1927, managing corporate finances and audits.

demographics.name: Franz Lang
demographics.demeanour: Precise and logical, with a talent for clear and concise technical communication.
demographics.backstory: Born 1895 in Berlin; earned a degree in mechanical engineering in 1919. Worked as a technical writer for a prominent machinery manufacturer in Tempelhof since 1925, drafting instruction manuals.

demographics.name: Dr. Karl Richter
demographics.demeanour: Scholarly and reflective, imparting knowledge with academic rigor and intellectual curiosity.
demographics.backstory: Born 1871 in Berlin; Ph.D. Philosophy 1897, University of Heidelberg. Has been a respected lecturer in the Humanities at Humboldt University of Berlin since 1905.

demographics.name: Klara Vogel
demographics.demeanour: Efficient and cordial, expertly managing a bustling establishment with a keen eye for customer satisfaction.
demographics.backstory: Born 1910 in Berlin; completed commercial training after high school. Quickly rose through the ranks to become manager of a popular restaurant in Prenzlauer Berg in 1933, known for its traditional German cuisine.

demographics.name: Elsa Weber
demographics.demeanour: Highly skilled and dedicated, with an artistic eye for precision craftsmanship.
demographics.backstory: Born 1892 in Berlin; trained as a jeweler's apprentice from a young age. Established her own workshop in 1920, renowned for her intricate stone setting.

demographics.name: Karl Meier
demographics.demeanour: Analytical and orderly, ensuring accuracy in data collection and analysis.
demographics.backstory: Born 1902; earned his master's degree in statistics in 1925. Employed as a statistical clerk in a Berlin government department, meticulously maintaining public records and compiling data.

demographics.name: Peter Hoffmann
demographics.demeanour: Experienced and meticulous, taking pride in his craftsmanship and attention to detail.
demographics.backstory: Born 1868 in Mecklenburg. Completed his tiling apprenticeship in 1885 and became a Master Tiler in 1892, establishing his own workshop in Charlottenburg.

demographics.name: Johanna Schmidt
demographics.demeanour: Conscientious and diligent, adept at managing technical details under pressure.
demographics.backstory: Completed vocational training in communications 1930. Employed since 1932 as a telecommunications operator at a central exchange in Berlin.

demographics.name: Jakob Fischer
demographics.demeanour: Scholarly and reserved, deeply knowledgeable in art history.
demographics.backstory: Born 1907 in Munich; completed doctorate in art history at Berlin University 1932. Joined the Pergamon Museum as an assistant curator in 1934, specializing in ancient artifacts.

demographics.name: Anna Hoffmann
demographics.demeanour: Methodical and precise, demonstrating a strong aptitude for numerical tasks.
demographics.backstory: Completed commercial school 1928. Employed as a financial clerk at a Berlin bank since 1930, handling client accounts and ledgers.

demographics.name: Paul Fischer
demographics.demeanour: Energetic and organized, adept at managing public recreational facilities.
demographics.backstory: Born 1911 in Berlin; completed a trade apprenticeship in hospitality management. Became supervisor of a local amusement park in 1933, ensuring smooth operations.

demographics.name: Karl Hoffmann
demographics.demeanour: Diligent and responsible, overseeing his crew with quiet authority.
interests: Listening to football on the radio
demographics.backstory: Completed trade school in 1895. He has worked for the Berliner Stadtreinigung since 1900, promoted to Municipal Sanitation Supervisor in 1920.

demographics.name: Karl Richter
demographics.demeanour: Methodical and authoritative, skilled in coordinating staff and hospital resources.
demographics.backstory: Born 1911 in Berlin; completed studies in public health administration. Promoted to Head of Operations at a city clinic in 1935, overseeing staff deployments.

demographics.name: Paul Müller
demographics.demeanour: Reflective and wise, with extensive experience in international commerce and world affairs.
demographics.backstory: Born 1851 in Hamburg. After high school, entered colonial trade in 1869, establishing connections across continents. Retired in 1920, residing in Köpenick.

demographics.name: Elisabeth Meier
demographics.demeanour: Diligent and methodical, focused on practical applications and efficiency in rural planning.
demographics.backstory: Born 1912 near Berlin; earned a degree in agricultural science in 1935. Works for the regional agricultural administration, advising local farms on crop rotation.

demographics.name: Karl Meier
demographics.demeanour: Eager and articulate, demonstrating a keen eye for detail in written works.
demographics.backstory: Began an apprenticeship at a Berlin publishing house 1933 after some college. Promoted to junior editor in 1935, primarily working on non-fiction titles.

demographics.name: Franz Weber
demographics.demeanour: Methodical and dependable, ensuring smooth administrative operations with quiet efficiency.
demographics.backstory: Born 1900 in Mainz; earned a business administration degree in 1923. Joined a Berlin textile company as an office administrator in 1924, managing payroll and correspondence.

demographics.name: Alix Böttcher
demographics.demeanour: Compassionate and knowledgeable, guiding individuals towards healthier dietary habits.
demographics.backstory: Born 1910; earned a bachelor's degree in domestic science in 1932. Worked as a dietary consultant in Berlin, advising families and institutions on proper nutrition.

demographics.name: Eleonore Schmidt
demographics.demeanour: Methodical and persuasive, dedicated to upholding medical standards.
demographics.backstory: Born 1891 in Berlin; completed her Abitur and studied chemistry. Began working as an agent for a pharmaceutical distributor in 1928, covering clinics across the city.

demographics.name: Dhruv Rattan
demographics.demeanour: Patient and analytical, dedicated to fostering practical skills in young people.
demographics.backstory: Born 1905 in British India, he arrived in Berlin in the late 1920s to study engineering. By 1932, he worked as a vocational instructor at a private trade school, teaching mechanical skills.

demographics.name: Emil Ebert
demographics.demeanour: Inquisitive and diligent, with a keen eye for detail.
demographics.backstory: Born 1914 in Berlin. Completed Abitur 1932. Assistant Archivist at the University of Berlin since 1934, cataloging historical documents.

demographics.name: Max Schoch
demographics.demeanour: Passionate and disciplined, committed to the welfare and training of horses.
demographics.backstory: Born 1917 in Brandenburg. Completed his specialized equestrian training in 1935. Began working as an apprentice stable manager at a private stud farm in Grunewald in 1936.

demographics.name: Werner Weber
demographics.demeanour: Calm and reassuring, dedicated to patient care and community health.
demographics.backstory: Graduated from medical school with a dentistry specialization in 1924. Established a successful private practice in Steglitz by 1928, serving local families.

demographics.name: Grete Scherer
demographics.demeanour: Quiet and contemplative, with a deep understanding of natural systems and forest management.
demographics.backstory: Born 1910 in Berlin; graduated with a degree in forestry in 1932. Works as an arboriculturist for the city's park administration, maintaining public green spaces.

demographics.name: Stefan Schulz
demographics.demeanour: Energetic and hands-on, takes pride in the quality of his workmanship.
demographics.backstory: Born 1913 in Berlin; completed high school and apprenticed as an industrial painter. Joined Siemens-Schuckertwerke in 1932, working on protective finishes for heavy machinery.

demographics.name: Walter Becker
demographics.demeanour: Personable and organized, adept at managing public inquiries and local resources.
demographics.backstory: Born 1885 in Berlin; trained in hospitality management at a trade school in 1904. Managed the city's central tourist information office from 1925, particularly busy during the Olympics.

demographics.name: Karl Hoffmann
demographics.demeanour: Analytical and pragmatic, skilled in translating complex designs into practical structures.
demographics.backstory: Born 1895 in Hamburg; completed his engineering degree at TU Berlin in 1920. Has worked as a structural engineer on various urban development projects across Berlin since 1923, contributing to public infrastructure.

demographics.name: Alicia Winkler
demographics.demeanour: Compassionate and authoritative, managing hospital ward operations with quiet efficiency.
demographics.backstory: Born 1871 in Berlin; completed nursing training in 1890. Served as a dedicated nurse for decades, becoming a respected head nurse at a Kreuzberg hospital by the 1920s.

demographics.name: Klaus Zimmermann
demographics.demeanour: Persuasive and adaptable, with a strong grasp of both mechanics and market needs.
demographics.backstory: Born 1908 in Berlin; earned a Master's in Mechanical Engineering in 1932. Joined a machinery firm as a Vertriebsingenieur in 1933, traveling to clients across the region.

demographics.name: Gisela Huber
demographics.demeanour: Organized and diligent, with a quiet but firm resolve.
demographics.backstory: Born 1878 in Saxony; completed advanced high school studies. Moved to Berlin in the 1900s, working as a bookkeeper for a small manufacturing firm in Schöneberg since 1910.

demographics.name: Dr. Heinrich Häring
demographics.demeanour: Erudite and traditional, upholding intellectual standards with a quiet authority.
demographics.backstory: Earned a doctorate in Philology from Humboldt University in 1898. Served as the Chief Librarian at a prominent public library in Berlin-Mitte for over three decades, witnessing its evolving role.

demographics.name: Heinrich Richter
demographics.demeanour: Diligent and precise, handling legal documentation with utmost care.
demographics.backstory: Born 1892; trained as a legal clerk in 1910. Worked for a Berlin legal firm for over two decades, specializing in property document preparation.

demographics.name: Norma Kessler
demographics.demeanour: Detail-oriented and highly organized, contributing precision to creative productions.
demographics.backstory: Completed a master's degree in film studies in 1928. Began working as a film editor at a Berlin studio in Tempelhof in 1929, contributing to documentaries and newsreels.

demographics.name: Margarete Schubert
demographics.demeanour: Highly organized and unflappable, adept at managing complex theatrical productions.
demographics.backstory: Completed studies in theatrical arts in 1895 and began her career in Berlin's vibrant theater scene. She has been a respected stage manager at a Charlottenburg theater for over two decades, known for her meticulous planning.

demographics.name: Franz Wagner
demographics.demeanour: Energetic and methodical, with a scholarly approach to physical education and youth development.
demographics.backstory: Earned a doctorate in physical education from the University of Leipzig in 1927. Moved to Berlin in 1929 to teach at a local gymnasium and organize youth sports leagues.

demographics.name: Lieselotte Bauer
demographics.demeanour: Intellectual and thoughtful, dedicated to academic pursuits.
demographics.backstory: Born 1902 in Berlin; received her degree in German literature from Berlin University 1926. Has been a lecturer at the university since 1928, focusing on 19th-century romanticism.

demographics.name: Nora Egger
demographics.demeanour: Practical and diligent, overseeing the smooth operation of daily tasks.
demographics.backstory: Born 1912 in Berlin; completed business college in 1932. Joined her family's parquet flooring business in 1932, managing client accounts and supplies.

demographics.name: Anton Kusch
demographics.demeanour: Meticulous and diligent, though sometimes appears anxious under pressure.
demographics.backstory: Born 1901 in Hamburg; earned his pharmacology bachelor's in 1923. Works in research and development for a Berlin pharmaceutical company since 1927, focusing on new drug compounds.

demographics.name: Anneliese Boutin
demographics.demeanour: Organized and authoritative, adept at managing complex operations and staff.
demographics.backstory: Graduated with a Master's degree in business from Heidelberg in 1900. Managed various establishments across Germany, overseeing a prominent Berlin hotel for over 15 years.

demographics.name: Ingrid Knappe-Drewes

demographics.backstory: Graduated with a Bachelor's in Civil Engineering in 1928 from a Berlin technical institute. Works as a construction technician for a local firm, contributing to city infrastructure projects.

demographics.name: Helga Schneider

demographics.backstory: Graduated high school in 1913. Beginning as a sales clerk, she advanced through the ranks to become a Department Store Manager at Wertheim Kaufhaus by 1930, overseeing significant sales operations.

demographics.name: Lena Schuster
demographics.demeanour: Intellectual and articulate, dedicated to scholarly pursuits and teaching.
demographics.backstory: Born 1908 in Berlin; earned a doctorate in linguistics from the University of Berlin. Joined the faculty in 1933, specializing in historical Germanic languages.

demographics.name: Johanna Weiss
demographics.demeanour: Observant and meticulous, skilled in precise measurement and drafting.
demographics.backstory: Born 1915 in Berlin; completed technical college courses in 1934. Works as a land surveyor's assistant for a construction company in Reinickendorf, involved in city planning projects.

demographics.name: Erich Mitschke
demographics.demeanour: Attentive and diligent, always ready to assist guests with their needs.
interests: Listening to travelogues on the radio
demographics.backstory: Born 1912 in Saxony, Erich moved to Berlin in 1930 for vocational training in hospitality. Since 1932, he has worked as a hotel desk clerk near Tiergarten, managing reservations and guest services.
